Job Description:
Job Description

Join the Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Field Sustainment (AFS) team as an F-16 Field Service Engineer (FSE) to support the Argentina Air Force (FAA) at Rio Cuarto Air Base, Cordoba Province, Argentina. Note: This position is located in Argentina and is an accompanied assignment - employee +1. This position will provide on-site advice, liaison, and informal training in the installation, operation and maintenance of equipment and systems related to F-16 on and off the aircraft.

The objective of the FSE is to elevate the technical skill and abilities of the personnel responsible for the operation and maintenance of F-16 aircraft and associated equipment/systems to a level of self-sufficiency.

What You Will Be Doing
Specific tasks include but are not limited to the following:
Provide on-site/on-equipment informal unit training to the component level on installation, maintenance and operating techniques pertaining to the adjustment, calibration, trouble-shooting, bench check, routine maintenance, inspection and repair of the prime equipment/system.
Provide advice in the identification of and instruction on the use of special tools, handling equipment, aerospace ground equipment (AGE) and test equipment associated with and related to F-16 aircraft and avionics systems.
Devise local informal training programs and provide advice in identifying needed training programs.
Emphasize safety precautions to be taken in all training provided. Demonstrate best methods of modifications and retrofit kits related to F-16 systems.
Render technical advice to resolve difficult and unusual maintenance problems. Provide consistent analysis of maintenance difficulties.
Provide advice on the establishment of maintenance, inspection and training programs designed to improve the quality of maintenance, recommending changes as applicable.
Provide liaison through which information related to maintenance and operational problems, available in the manufacturer's plant, can be quickly disseminated to operations and maintenance personnel.
Provide training on the use and interpretation of applicable technical orders. Provide advice as requested to assist in accident investigation and preparing failure data reports and unsatisfactory reports.

Must be willing to work a flexible schedule to accommodate customer requirements as needed.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Must have an at minimum an Interim Secret Security Clearance. Must be able to obtain a Final Secret Security Clearance.

Selected candidate must pass an overseas physical.


You excel at working alongside team members and customers, leveraging collective strengths to achieve shared goals and deliver exceptional results.

You enjoy building strong, productive relationships with colleagues, enhancing team cohesion and collaboration.

You are committed to being present on-site, facilitating real-time collaboration and problem-solving with your team.

What to Expect
The Rotating Equipment Engineer is a technical position supporting routine maintenance of all rotating equipment within a refinery, reliability efforts, and small capital projects. The position helps ensure correct identification of failure mechanisms, timely technical assessment of repair plans and alternatives, provides technical knowledge to pump and turbine maintenance, development of turnaround scope, and overall availability and reliability of rotating equipment.

Apply rotating equipment technical knowledge to support maintenance, operations, projects, turnarounds, and other mechanical integrity activities.
Assist in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of complex equipment and systems, ensuring timely and effective repairs.
Communicate and manage to resolution, emerging high-risk pump and compressor issues.
Participate on small projects and help develop detailed engineering drawings, test procedures, and specifications to meet performance standards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive process improvements and recommend technical enhancements.
Conduct root cause analyses, support risk-based inspections, and document best practices to address reliability issues for rotating equipment.
Ensure all engineering activities comply with regulatory and company standards, prioritizing safety and quality.
Invest in ongoing professional development to stay current with industry trends and contribute to a culture of innovation.

The is located in Westlake, Louisiana. Refinery facilities include crude distilling, naphtha reforming, fluid catalytic cracking, alkylation, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units. Facilities also include a specialty coker and calciner. The refinery processes a mixture of light to heavy, low- and high sulfur and low- and high-acid crude oils. It receives domestic, Canadian and other foreign crude oil through truck, pipeline, marine transportation and terminals, including the Beaumont and Clifton Ridge terminals and the Bayou Bridge Pipeline. Other products include off-road diesel, home heating oil, feedstock for our Excel Paralubes joint venture, specialty graphite petroleum coke and petroleum coke. Refined products are distributed in the southeastern and eastern United States by truck, rail car, barge or pipelines and exported to Latin America and West Africa.
